answerText: Li-Young _Lee_[10] Another man who wrote about fruit was this poet, who described plums that are "delicious / so sweet / and so cold" in "This is Just to Say." He also wrote "The Red Wheelbarrow."
heading: Western Invitational Tournament |2013 | Alabama + Georgia Tech+ WUStL | 20 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: He wrote about his father painting hundreds of paintings after going blind, describing "the feel of the wolftail on the silk." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet who wrote about the title fruit "swelled, heavy as sadness, / and sweet as love" in "Persimmons." This Chinese-American poet is a grandson of early 20th century warlord Yuan Shikai.
